Package processing2hpgl

Class Plotter

java.lang.Object
processing2hpgl.Plotter
public class Plotter extends Object
This is a library for interfacing with Pen Plotters that use HPGL. The goal of the library enable communication with a pen plotter while closely mimicking Processing functions. See the Plot example to see a sketch that showcase the current functionality of the library. Testing with a HP7475A Pen Plotter connected to Macbook via FTDI Usb cable.

  • Constructor Details

    • Plotter

      public Plotter(processing.core.PApplet theParent, processing.serial.Serial _port, int _xMin, int _yMin, int _xMax, int _yMax, float _scale, boolean _debug)
      Plotter Constructor, setup the
      Parameters:
      theParent - the parent PApplet
      _port - the serial port for the printer
      _xMin - the minimum x position for the plotter
      _yMin - the minimum y position for the plotter
      _xMax - the maximum x position for the plotter
      _yMax - the maximum y postion for the plotter
      _scale - the scale factor for the printer
      _debug - a boolean, true will print a bunch of helpful messages.

    • lineType

      public void lineType(int mode)
      Change the type of line to draw
      Parameters:
      mode - int between 0 and 6 to set line mode, https://www.isoplotec.co.jp/HPGL/eHPGL.htm#-LT(Line%20Type)

    • lineType

      public void lineType(int mode, float space)
      Change the type of line to draw
      Parameters:
      mode - int between 0 and 6 to set line mode, https://www.isoplotec.co.jp/HPGL/eHPGL.htm#-LT(Line%20Type)
      space - float representing spacing. A percent of the total line length, i.e. 10 would space the dashes 10% of the total line length

    • fillType

      public String fillType(int model)
      Set the Fill Type, 1 or 2
      Parameters:
      model - Fill model, 1 or 2
      Returns:
      a string of hpgl commands for fills

      Returns:
